This is a JUnit thing, not a runtime thing. As far as I know, JUnit runs the methods in alphabetical order. I don't believe that there is anything we could have done to change this. :-)
I'm looking for a comment on how SessionTestSuite and SessionRunner are supposed to work ... i.e. how is it supposed to be used so a multi-session test works.  It looks like these are owned by platform core.

It's not alphabetical, by the way :-)

PW
I've released a change for I20070201-0800 so that the methods' definition order is the same as their sort order.

PW
Talked with DJ.

SessionTestSuite just depends on junit3 TestSuite.  When you build a test suite from a class it just uses getDeclaredMethods(), which returns an un-ordered (usually declaration order) list of methods.

The solution to gaurantee session tests order is to explicitly add the tests when creating the WorkbenchTestSuite.

As an aside, there are a lot of session tests in the system that depend on the fact that getDeclaredMethods() *usually* returns them in declaration order.

PW
